Reviews.Title: “Good property in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaJon
Reviews.Content: I attended a meeting at this hotel. The layout of the hotel is interesting in that it is a series of buildings. The rooms were large and comfortable. The bathroom sink was in a small dressing area separate from the shower and toilet. If you have a car this is an ideal location for getting to the Old Town section of the city, north to LaJolla, downtown or Seaport Village. Without a car it's about a $20 cab ride. The hotel is close to the airport but because of its location there's no jet noise, unless there's occasional military traffic into the North Island facility. The meeting staff was great and very attentive to our group. The food for our meeting was in the room on time. Coffeee and sodas were replenished regularly. The quality of the food was excellent. If there's one knock on this property it's that their restaurant closes at 9 PM (10 on Friday and Saturday). Luckily there are a number of restaurants in walking distance where you can go.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Robert T
Reviews.Content: Have just spent 3 nights at this hotel after reading the review,s about the HI on the Bay I am pleased we stayed at the HI Bayside. The location of this hotel was ideal for us as we had a car, without one perhaps it would be a problem, also of course parking is free not $20+ that other nearby hotels charge. On arrival we checked in very efficiently and were presented with 6 complimentary drinks vouchers and 6 breakfast vouchers, we used 2 of the drinks vouchers when we had a meal in the onsite Point Loma cafe, the food was fine but not exceptional, on the other 2 nights we had dinner in the downtown area, Anthonys being one of them of course. Having read the reviews about the breakfast we did not use the vouchers and organised our own continental type fare for which the fridge in the room came in handy. We were in the rear block looking at the houses and hotels behind the HI, not as good as looking at the marina but fine all the same, we sat on the small balconey on Friday evening and watched the world go by with a drink. The onsite small store sold the basics and we found it handy, also for members of the IHG reward scheme, Priority Club there is a room which has been made into a lounge for Gold and Platinum members(1326) it has a TV, computer with printer, bowl of fruit and snack bars, some visitors may find it handy. We will certainly stay here again and can recommend the hotel to others, its location right on North Harbour Drive was ideal for us as it was just a short drive to all the points of interest we wished to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Couple Get away”
Reviews.Author: Gorgeou
Reviews.Content: I want to congradulate all staff for great customer Service. I had a few small issues that were resolved fast..Thankyou..Thankyou..I also want to say the Food in the Cafe was great..and a big Thankyou to Jodi..great hard working person always on top of things..Great Personality...I also want to say Thankyou TONY for such a great time at the Bar Very friendly guy.. great service :) Great Drinks..Thankyou all for making Our Stay feel great all see you all soon again next month. We both enjoyed our stay..

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a pre-cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: J0hanna7
Reviews.Content: We arrived for our cruise to Hawaii here 2 days prior and stayed at the Holiday Inn Bayside. We got there early due to the 3 hour time change and we got our room immediately. They were very pleasant and easy to deal with. After going to our room, we were pleasantly surprised. We asked for first floor and got it. Opened the door and the room was great but the big surprise was the patio doors to a patio with a table and chairs and poolside. The room also had a coffee maker with all the fixings for coffee and tea and was well equipped with soaps, lotions and such as well as a flat screen TV., We booked for 2 nights so had a free day in between. We perused the booklets and such in the office and decided the hop on hop off trolley sounded nice. They told us where to meet at 9:30 a.m. and the trolley would pick us up. We had a wonderful day sightseeing in San Diego and ate at the Seaside Village. Wonderful. My favorite Ice cream was on offer. Ben & Jerry's chunky monkey. The day of the cruise, they had a free shuttle to the port. The hotel has a nice restaurant beside it where we ate breakfast and it was a huge meal and quite cheap. Under $10. each.

Reviews.Title: “'Would never stay here again'”
Reviews.Author: Melleasa
Reviews.Content: Myself and my father stayed here September 2011 for three nights and hated every minute the room l stayed in stunk something cronic,and the room my father stayed in we would have to say was haunted seriously he stayed in a end room,and the side of his room their was knocking and banging every night we were there.All l can say is l plan in the future to go back to San Diego as it is a really beautiful city but l plan on staying at the Holiday inn across from the Maritime Museum as that looks a really nice CLEAN hotel,please do not stay at this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: WizardBristol
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night after flying in from the UK and had a king room which, although clean and fresh, was a little on the small side. We also stayed for 4 nights at the end of our trip; this time we had booked a one bedroom suite and we were not disappointed. The suite (on the 4th floor) was huge and had 2 bathrooms. The bedroom was a corner room with floor to ceiling windows which afforded lovely views over the marina and bay. The hotel cafe was good for breakfast, and there are several restaurants within walking distance - Jimmy's Famous Ale Tavern being one of them - good food and cocktails. Free parking. Would stay here again if in the area, and would definitely pay the extra for a suite.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to the airport, Pt Loma, and Shelter Island”
Reviews.Author: VATraveler55
Reviews.Content: First - the Holiday inn Bayside in San Diego, is notthe Holiday inn "On the Bay" in San Diego. Althoughboth are located on Harbor Drive, the Bayside is Northwest of the Airport about a block from Rosecrans St. The other is located in downtown on the embarcadero. We stayed at the Bayside only one night as we had an early morning flight. We found the hotel to be convenient to the airport. The shuttle begins running at 5am pretty much on call or at about 15 minute intervals for the less than 2 mile run to the terminals. The other nice thing about the location is th access to Shelter Island for restaurants and nightlife. A short walk across Scott St. will bring you to several good long standing seafood restaurants. The hotel itself is quite nice with a restaurant, bar and convenience store on premises. The staff is friendly and professional, and the rooms completely in standard with the Holiday Inn brand. I would recommend this location for people spending several days to a week in San Diego, as it offers ease of parking and road access as well as a location central to either driving or walking to various venues.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: pradipd25
Reviews.Content: All my reviews for hotels are based upon value for money i.e. whether you received value for whatever you paid. Otherwise, it is impossible and unfair to compare a Motel 6 with a Holiday Inn with an Intercontinental with an Aman Resort. Also, 2 people may pay different amounts and therefore will have a different value perception. I paid $59 per nite for this hotel, and based upon this I feel this was excellent value. This is in spite of the following flaws. The room (I was upgraded to a deluxe whatever that means) and the bathroom were smallish, but there was a view of the marina. The bed was clean and comfortable and the wifi was reasonably fast except in the night when all hotel wifis slow down to a crawl. There is no extra charge for wifi, parking and breakfast even though breakfast as with all Holiday Inns in the USA is inedible since they only buy and provide industrially produced items of dubious quality consisting primarily of the flesh of dead animals. The most unnerving thing was the layout of the hotel with multiple entrances and lobbies, numerous parking areas, confusing set of elevators etc. as a result of all this, security was a concern since none of the doors were security enabled and were always open 24/7. The location of the hotel was ideal with easy access to the freeways and local areas, and minutes from almost any where.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Gregsuzanne
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location and is ok (just getting a bit old now) but neat and tidy and Internet is free. The only disappointment is that they say that breakfast is included in the room rate but only give you $20 credit at the in house restaurant and if you both have a coffee and a juice you have used $12 before you start to order food. I think they need to look at increasing the amount that they give you or inform customers that this is all you receive and not a full breakfast as stated on the net.

Reviews.Title: “North Harbor Drive location convenient to airport”
Reviews.Author: explorer630
Reviews.Content: Nice location - across from small boat harbor and just two miles west of the airport (very convenient if you need to get to the airport early in the morning as I did). The hotel consists of older, two-story buildings with outdoor entrances surrounding the pool area, and a five story tower with inside corridors. I stayed in the tower. Room had been refurbished fairly recently and was very clean, although the interior corridors, while clean and well-maintained, could use some freshening. The king-side bed was comfortable. There was a choice of pillows, from soft to firm, although I would have liked the pillows to be larger. Room included a large flat screen TV and mini-refrigerator. Business center in the tower has two computers and printers for guest use, although both computers were hopelessly slow. I got a great rate through the Entertainment Club, although it would have been nice if breakfast were included.

Reviews.Title: “They seem to be trying”
Reviews.Author: hscohn
Reviews.Content: We got one of their Amtrak Kidsuites. This room is really small, but the bunk beds for the kids really made them happy. The location is not too noisy despite being close to the airport. They seem to be trying to make this a more upscale property and have lots of activities. Not a whole lot to do close by so you have to pretty much drive everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a early morning flight”
Reviews.Author: BarbraYoung1945
Reviews.Content: My daughters stayed here for a early morning flight , since we live pretty far from the airport. And the hotel is great for that. It's close to the airport And other attractions. The hotel was ok but you can tell it's old. If your just looking to be close to everything then this hotel is the place to be. If your looking for a 5 star resort feeling your not gonna get it from here..

Reviews.Title: “Good location, value, and comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: bluefaery
Reviews.Content: My 2 night stay was very comfortable here. It is a good location. I've stayed in the area before at a Courtyard Marriot and also practically next door at a Best Western. This was right in the middle both price wise and value wise. I do believe this will now be the hotel I choose for my San Diego business trips. I felt like the area was safe and was close to whatever I needed. The room was very comfortable as was the bed. All the staff I encountered was friendly. I ordered room service and it was shocking how quick my food came. This seems like a good hotel for both business and vacation travelers. I was very happy with my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good property and location”
Reviews.Author: LBOskiBear
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night for a work trip. The location is easy to find as it's just past the airport as you approach Point Loma. It's also just past the newly developoed Liberty Station area with restaurants and a Starbucks. The check in was easy and as a Platinum member, was upgraded to a huge suite. The views are nice of the marina. It's great to be this close to the city and yet feel like it's quiet and removed.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Boro p
Reviews.Content: I had a good time at this hotel. Rooms were clean and beddins were comfortable. hotel located in a good location. Staff was ok. Breakfast was good

Reviews.Title: “You will want to hang out here!”
Reviews.Author: scatteredlife
Reviews.Content: I got to tag along to this hotel when my husband attended a 5-day training seminar. I was without a car for a couple days, so I really got to check this place out. First off, it is very close to the airport and other San Diego attractions which is nice, but because it is in Point Loma, you get the added flavor of a long-time boating community of Portuguese tuna fishermen and America's Cup sailors. It is close to Ocean Beach and Cabrillo Lighthouse. Favorite things about this hotel: Location, free bicycle rentals, well-maintained heated outdoor pool/hottub with plenty of towels, and great employees. You will see families, business clients, and older military clientele and sailors because of San Diego's military heritage. We were honored to be there during a reunion of WW2 bomber veterans. Be sure to take advantage of the free bicycle rentals!!! Free for 2 hours. They don't have gears but you wont need them. Best route- Out of the hotel take a right on Harbor Drive, then left on Scott, left on Shelter Island Drive. Go all the way to the end of Shelter Island (you will love it) then turn around and come back past the hotel and take a left on Laning Rd to Liberty Station (Google it!). You can take a side road before that if you want. Once off the main road, go to the right and you will find an awesome bike path! It is safe, beautiful and peaceful. Ride it to the end ....you can this whole trip well within the 2 hours... probably less than 1 hour if you don't get tempted to stop anywhere. Liberty Station has a Von's grocery store, Trader Joes, and tons of well priced eating places! Driving tip regarding the area: Point Loma is a well-established area of the city with older streets that aren't laid out that great. Even a fancy model GPS might fail you here! Get a map and go with the map, not your GPS. You will get to Ocean Beach, Sunset Cliffs, and Cabrillo Monument much quicker and with less traffic if you use a map. Caveats/reason for 4 stars: There a several building types (highrise, 2-story), so I can't speak for them all. Our room was in the 2-story and close to the pool but in a marginally good location-- too close to parking lot (see room tips). The mattress seemed a little older and not the type of bed that makes you go, "Ahhhh" when you lay down, but I have had worse and the bedding (sheets/pillows/etc) were nice and comfy. Maybe other rooms are better?

Reviews.Title: “"Great Hotel"”
Reviews.Author: Nigel W
Reviews.Content: We stayed here recently for 10 nights and our room was on the 4th floor. The room was clean, modern and very quiet. The hotel in general was very well kept and in a very nice part of san diego with easy access to all the major attractions such as Seaworld etc. The staff here were pleasant and helpful. We used the on-site restaurant for breakfast and dinner quite a lot and were very impressed with the quality of food and the very reasonable prices. We will definately stay here again on our next trip to San Diego Nigel Witts UK

Reviews.Title: “Not My Kind of Place”
Reviews.Author: HugeCat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn San Diego-Bayside for one night because it was close to the airport. Here are the good points: The hotel is close to the airport with a nice shuttle service if you need it. The driver was polite and friendly and helped with my bags. The hotel provided Bath and Body Works products in the rooms. The bed was comfortable with clean, fresh linens. Although I didn't use it, there was a nice-sized flat screen TV in the room. Now the negative points: We were in a first floor room in the section with outdoor corridors, which I do not like because of both noise and safety issues. The room had an odd floor plan with the bathroom sink just inside the door and the toilet and tub in a separate room. The room had an overwhelming musty smell upon entering and was very humid feeling. Items in the room such as the lamps, coffee maker, and coffee packages felt sticky. I wore shoes at all times on the carpet and tile. It was quite noisy, from a variety of sources including road and air traffic, plumbing, the fridge, and those being amorous in the room above. The room was quite a walk from the lobby which resulted in dragging my luggage through a couple of parking lots to get the shuttle. i think all in all I would try another hotel in the area rather than staying at this location again.

Reviews.Title: “The place to go”
Reviews.Author: rwjones52
Reviews.Content: The one negative note is that this is on the far side of the airport for me (I work in Coronado), and it took me a bit longer to get to work than I would prefer. If you work in the Point Loma area, it would be great. But for Coronado, not the best. Not crazy-bad, just not the best. The upside, though, far outweighed the downside. -There is ample free parking. And I do mean ample. -They gave me not just breakfast coupons, but dinner coupons and drink coupons as well...all redeemable at the Point Loma Cafe, just next door. And I got very good meals there. -It's in the vicinity of Shelter Island and a bunch of nice dockside, seafood restaurants if you like that sort of thing (I do). -Good Internet service. All in all the best value for Holiday Inns that I've found in San Diego so far. I will return.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Harbour Location in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Seamo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Bayside for one night, having driven to San Diego from Las Vegas during the day and prior to a longer stay in the centre of the city. The hotel was quite easy to find off North Harbor Drive and parking was both easy and free. Check-in was quick, friendly & professional and the single elevator took us up to our fourth floor room with a view of the harbour. Our room was fairly compact but had enough room for our overnight stay. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom was clean with a good shower. Pretty standard Holiday Inn fare but very much in line with expectations, plus the coffee machine was quickly put to good use to revive us after our long drive. The wi-fi internet worked well too, which was important to us. We had breakfast vouchers to the value of $20 each and the breakfast we had the next morning was the best of our three week stay in America. We had 'full American' cooked food, with plenty of juice & coffee, and enjoyed the hustle & bustle of the hotel's diner-style cafe. We had eaten the night before, incidentally, at Jimmy's Famous American Tavern and that was excellent too, by the way. Great beers! In summary, a pleasant overnight stay and even though we didn't use the pool & other facilities they looked good so a longer stay would be potentially OK too. Good value and a good stay so thank you HI Bayside!

Reviews.Title: “"Dated" Property in perfect condition”
Reviews.Author: MARK L
Reviews.Content: I visited this Holiday Inn Bayside, San Diego on 11-17 Sept 2011 and it was a great experience! When the complimenatry hotel's van picked me up at San Diego International airport, about 3 miles away, my skepticism kicked-in because this particular property is an older design, circa 1950's. But, this mangement company has maintained this beautiful property and it was a trip down nostagia-way with a few updated, modern conveniences such as: Complimenatry WiFi, USA Today newspaper, Free Lunch, Dinner and Drink coupons everyday of my stay. Note: I did not have to spend any additional monies for food or beverage my entire stay. My room was located on the second floor overlooking the pool. The pool area was beautiful. Full of flowers, palm trees, grass so soft you wanted to walk bare foot! In fact, all the flowers, plants and trees, property wide (not just the pool area) had signage on them educating you on all the foilage. It was a great touch because as my wife was admiring a plant you never see back-home, the first question she had was: "What is the name of the plant?" The pool area, pool and hot-tub were professionally maintained; clean, towels in a self-serve cabana, waterfalls, flowers and most important, the hot-tub actually worked (water-jets) and it was HOT! As I entered my room, I was very impressed with the accommodations. Two queen-size beds with the most comfortable mattress and pillows I have ever slept on in years. In fact, I bought 4-pillows (only $10 each;couldn't believe the price!) from the hotel and they are shipping them to me at no charge. Plenty of big, soft towels, 46" flat screen HD-TV with complimentary HBO, refrigerator, Free WiFi, and the biggest standard hotel room I've stayed in years. This hotel is conveient to everything. Harbor Island is only 3 miles(great restaurants here), and downtown San Diego is about 6 miles. In fact, the hotel's van took us there at no charge and saved us money on a cab fare! My business meeting was held in the Catering Department of the hotel. The Catering staff did a great job in taking care of our group. From a clean meeting room, to A/V equipment that was set-up and worked without a hitch, to fresh, hot coffee and cookies. I (we) really appreciated the Catering staff. The restaurant was not large, but it was fast, efficient and I was impressed on how many "locals" used this dining facility...when "locals" visit on a regular basis, you know that it's great...and it was! Great breakfast, large portions and a staff that was very friendly and helpful. The entire staff seemed to come from the same mold, everyone was helpful, friendly and always went out-of-the-way to assit you. Lola, the overnight desk clerk was as good as it gets. By the way, the property also has a wonderful bar that opens up into the pool area. They had live music and the complimentary drink coupons were very helpful although we did spend money on snacks! The Gift Shop had everything we needed and more. So, if you forgot something, chances are they have it! Wow, we really enjoyed our stay and appreciated the trip down memory lane. This Holiday Inn reminded me of a 1957 Chevy that had been restored and when we saw the green-colored spot-lights that illuminated the hotel's property, it stuck a deep memory of what Holiday Inn's looked in the 50's and 60's. The only negatives were two items: 1) If you stayed on the traditional two-story building as we did, there isn't an elevator for handicapped or if you had many pieces of luggage, as we did, it was a little work getting up-the-stairs. 2) The rooms did not have microwaves; we like microwaves to heat up leftovers and we love our popcorn! But, if I get to San Diego again, I will stay at this wonderfully maintained, customer friendly and "modern" hotel. Thanks for a GREAT stay!

Reviews.Title: “Sleep Hot! On Tiny Pillows”
Reviews.Author: Sawwhetowls2
Reviews.Content: We were able to check-in early. The room was beautiful but we like to sleep cool usually 67 degrees. The thermostat wouldn't allow us to go lower than 69 degrees. I'm all for being Eco-conscientious but NOT when it comes to my sleeping comfort. They should have told us this up front. The king bed had 4 small not even STD pillows that my head would roll off of. Elevator was SLOW. Restaurant was good and free drinks with priority club membership. Free WIFI -AWESOME!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel in a great town!”
Reviews.Author: jenkins585
Reviews.Content: We had a great couples vacation and stayed here on our last night in San Diego. We had originally booked a king room but got upgraded to a suite that would have slept our whole family! The staff was all very nice and our breakfast the next morning was excellent. We will definitely try this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: GoMrB
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed for 2 nights a Holiday Inn San Diego-Bayside this past weekend to spend some time at Sea World. What a wonderful place to stay! Not only was the room very nice, the staff was extremely friendly, but the internet access was lightning fast! I would highly recommend staying at Holiday Inn San Diego-Bayside if you are visiting San Diego for business or pleasure because the ammenities are plentiful and the locations is within minutes of anywhere you wish to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Kids loved the view”
Reviews.Author: B T
Reviews.Content: We found this through a travel site for a great price. Got in late after flying from Atlantic Coast, and our room was ready and comfortable. The hotel is a little older, but our young kids loved the view of the bay. It was definitely better than being cramped up at my relatives house.

Reviews.Title: “If you're running the America's Finest City half or doing the SD triathlon, stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: cog480
Reviews.Content: We stayed here again this year for the America's Finest City half marathon. Again, the hotel had free breakfast vouchers for my children, a great, warm pool for the kids to swim, and a movie shown by the pool on the Saturday night. The room was nice and quiet, and conveniently located on the race route, so I was able to walk out with the kids to cheer on the runners. Further, I was able to get a couple of post race beer for the runners at the bottleshop on the premises cheaper than if I'd driven to a convenience store or in a restaurant. I will likely skip the Sheraton and save the money by staying here year after year for the AFC race. (Oh, and free high-speed internet is available and appreciated!) Last, across the street is a great italian restaurant - Pizza Nova. Delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Weekend in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Hawaii721
Reviews.Content: Over all not a bad Holiday Inn. The location is not where I thought it was by Mission Bay. I just looked at Holiday Inn "Bayside" and read no further. It was a few miles from the airport across the street from the Marina. The rooms were very clean and the beds very comfortable. Heated pool with an awful color green color water and a very tiny spa. Crowded at night. The worst thing I can say about this Holiday Inn is the parking. It is 4 separate buildings with parking in front. Came back from a movie one night at 9:30 pm and had to park at the furtherst building from our room. This particular lot was near an public lot and did not feel real safe. The place does have a great restaurant on site with very friendly employees as everyone was here. Would stay again but come back from activites earlier in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “It was good-we would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: silverton123
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for only 1 night. They were giving us rooms at the annex, but requested a room at the tower instead because I read on TripAdvisor that they're newer rooms. We had no problems finding parking, which was free. The rooms had two double beds and was clean. It had plantation shutters from floor to ceiling which was nice so we can appreciate the partial view of the harbor. The beds were comfortable enough, but the pillows were not, but no big deal. The bathroom was very small-there were three of us and it got crowded when going into the shower. There was no room for garbage by the sink. We did not use the pool so I can't comment on that. The gym was sufficient for exercising, but smelled moldy since it was in the older section of the hotel. We had breakfast at the attached Cafe and my daughter raved about the biscuits and gravy. We got credit for two beverages since we got two complimentary tickets for drinks since I was a Priority Club Member.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel for a great downtown location”
Reviews.Author: missmumbles
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here one night immediately preceding our departure. We selected it primarily due to its close proximity to the airport and low rate ($126 for a king on the 2nd floor). As it would turn out, I ended up falling very ill on our final night so we didn't experience much at the hotel other than the room. The room was spacious and clean and the bed was super comfortable. It also had a nice balcony overlooking the putting green. One annoyance was that the toilet water would run so we had to jiggle the handle after each use. And, the air conditioner was a bit loud - a constant humming. It didn't bother us too much as it may have masked outside noises or air traffic and we found that not all hotels in San Diego even offer AC. The hotel itself was in a convenient location, very close to area attractions, the airport, and gas stations. It had ample free parking, which is a tremendous value-add that we came to appreciate more and more during our 2-week stay in Southern California.

Reviews.Title: “Hawaii in California”
Reviews.Author: BobM2011
Reviews.Content: What a great place stay. We had a room with a garden view and just off pool side. I had heard that San Diego was like Hawaii but until waking up in this room had not experienced it. The hotel was very clean with extremely nice rooms with granite countertops, tile floors in the bathing area and nice amenities. Family friendly environment with billiards, ping-pong and shuffle board by the pool as well as complimentary bicycles you can take on ride along the waterfront. The staff was friendly and helpful at every encounter. The beds were comfy with lots of extra pillows. We will definitely stay again when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing place! Next time we're bringing the kids.”
Reviews.Author: mzbarbier
Reviews.Content: This HI was a nice little surprise! Booked online for a spontaneous but cheap 4 day weekend with my husband. First night we had one of the older rooms but we didn't check in until 11PM so no surprise there. The next day we asked for a different room and got a poolside room. Wonderful space right on the putting green. The restaurant was good and the vouchers we received were an extra bonus. Restaurant staff is very friendly, as is the evening desk clerk. Pool is nice and wasn't that cold (even in March). Never went to the bar area but it looked clean and was rather busy. Had a wonderful stay and will be bringing the boys next time!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Stay away”
Reviews.Author: lillyjoe25
Reviews.Content: Old motel style , recently remodelated but dirty, stinky , stains in the linnens, 1000 year old mattress , expensive ,just not worth it .

Reviews.Title: “Would NOT recommend this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: luvnmymd
Reviews.Content: We stayed on 4th of July weekend. The first night we did not sleep at all because the air conditioning did not work and there were no windows to open.. Very hot and old muskey smell... They moved us to another room the next day and in that room I found a bug that sure looked like a bed bug.. ( Which the manager swears it couldnt be because the room was recently inspected for bed bugs) While I was looking behind the bed to see if I found anymore I found it to be very dirty and appeared it hadnt been deep cleaned for some time. also the bathroom in both of the rooms were not very clean. All though I did not find any other bugs my son woke the next day with several red puffy bites on him.. This trip was very disipointing and was a waste of money being that we could not enjoy our vacation to the fullest from being so tired and not being able to come back to the room sleep and get some rest.. The ONLY plus to this hotel is the Restaurant and the nice staff .. I have worked in Hotel management for many years and if one of my guests experienced this on their visit I would have refunded at least one night... I dont like writing reviews like this to bad mouth a place but I sure think people need to know what to expect..

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel - very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: meadowlands1508
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 2 nights. Room was a family room with bunk beds for the kids - divider didn't go all the way to the ceiling which meant you couldn't have both tvs on in the room and it was a bit disturbing having a large mural of afican animals on the wall facing the master bed but the kids loved it. nice touches like a little dressing table for them in the kids area. location was close to the airport and we didn't notice any aircraft noise at all. Across the street from the marina which was lovely to walk along, there are a couple of places to eat there. Parking was free and we got complimentary drinks vouchers for each night as well as kids eat free vouchers for the on site restaurant. Staff were excellent we got got back to the hotel after a long day at Sea world to discover the power was our in a 2 block radius. staff helped with torches and bottled water for everyone and were doing everything they could to help out.- couldn't fault them. hotel is a little tired in places and seems to have bits of the rooms renovated and not others. Pool area etc were really nice. Didn't use all the facilities as we weren't' there long enough. only a 10 min drive to Seaworld and 5 mins to the Old town so good location for that, not much to walk to but would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel close to airport”
Reviews.Author: jerseyguy405
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night before flying back home. Hotel is clean, quiet, and comfortable. It is close to airport, restaurants, and Old Town. I didn't use the pool/hot tub area but it looked nice. I will stay here again when in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Front Desk people helpful but hotel needs complete renovation”
Reviews.Author: localvegan
Reviews.Content: We came here for the 4th of July for 2 nights but we check out the next day. The room was so hot, the a/c wasn't working, just fan. I woke up sweating all over. The bathroom were really old and small, we cant hardly move around. The worst part is when the next door is taking a shower in the middle of the night, it makes a lot of noise in our bedroom. The walls are too thin too, I could hear the children crying a lot. I have stayed on a lot of Holiday Inns in US and overseas. They are usually decent looking. Some are a lot smaller but modern/updated amenities, some are I could rate 5 stars or more. But this should be paid attention by owner to retain the good reputation of Holiday Inn Hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great surprise!”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaC_c
Reviews.Content: I was a little hesitant to stay at this Holiday Inn because I had read some good, some bad reviews. But I was pleasantly surprised!! The hotel is very clean and updated. Our room had a separate vanity area, then the shower/toilet in another area. We had free parking and wifi. The best part is the hotel is across the street from the harbor, and it is sooooo pretty and has amazing restaurants located there. The hotel is smoking/non-smoking, and we really can't handle the smell of smoking, so I was scared I'd smell remnants of smoke, but we couldn't smell any smoke at all. It's also close to the airport, but we didn't hear any planes overhead. I would totally recommend this hotel, in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Staff EVER!”
Reviews.Author: MrsWillis
Reviews.Content: On first look, I thought the hotel was subpar...BUT I was in for the shock of my life. This hotel is amazing, mostly because of an awesome staff. Jon at the front desk is a treasure. Everyone down to the busboys for the restaurant (Point Loma Cafe) are truly superb. They are knowledgeable and friendly and left me with a great impression!

Reviews.Title: “Coronado Beach was a breath of fresh air”
Reviews.Author: galsings
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was very accommodating and informed us of local transportation and events in the area. They shuttled to and from the airport and around town as well. The restaurant had the best dinner specials (the salmon was excellent) that kept us coming back for more. Our compliments to the chef. My first visit to San Diego has been so memorable that I plan to go back real soon and continue where I left off.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing value and great. Location”
Reviews.Author: hansudo
Reviews.Content: Rooms are nice big screen tv and decent coffee. Plenty of amenities. Only con is parking. You may have to walk a short distance

Reviews.Title: “Good Spot”
Reviews.Author: trixietg
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel for the price. Our room was spotless and is considerably larger than a typical room with two queen beds. The ceilings are high and a bar with two stools is wrapped around one corner, adding to the spaciousness. Nice TV and fridge. The layout, including a huge closet (large enough to lay out two huge suitcases and hang lots of clothes) and nice make-up mirror, worked very well for us, allowing me to get ready in the morning without having to light up the whole room. The parking is free but we did have to hunt down a space a couple of times. The location was good for the tourist things we chose to do. Weather was cool, so didn't use the pool. The only negative was a mildewy smell in the corridor, but not in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resortish Feel”
Reviews.Author: scooplady
Reviews.Content: Booked for one night on a Priority Club Free Night gift, on arrival we realized that we had been upgraded to a corner suite, possibly the best room on the property, very, very nice!! The remainder of our 4-night stay was in a standard King bed room, we didn't think the hotel had done a great job maintaining the stone walls of the tub enclosure. The issue wasn't resolved while we were still guests but has been resolved satisfactorily now. We had a couple of other minor concerns, a leaky iron and key cards that failed us one morning, both were resolved immediately. On the good side of the story, the hotel has a very nice resortish look and feel. A very nice pool, hot tub and outdoor lounge area is accompanied by an attractive bar and a good restaurant where we enjoyed 4 very nice breakfasts and excellent service. The location is very good, 5 minutes from the airport, it's only a brief drive or cab ride to the many San Diego experiences that can be enjoyed. The hotel has bicycles available for rent, a very nice change of pace. There are also very nice ocean front walking (not bicycling) paths nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, we'll be back for sure!”
Reviews.Author: MamaMel73
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just an all around great place to stay. The room was very nice. The only room complaint is that our air conditioning didn't work great but it worked well enough. The guest service employees were wonderful. The pool and hot tub were great! They were clean and it was a very nice area to lounge. There was also shuffle board and table tennis but we didn't use either. We did take advantage of the free bike use. The bikes were great beach cruisers and we went for a nice ride down to shelter island. All in all this was a great hotel at a great price and we will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, good restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Christine_Roger
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights here, very nice room with a view across the bay. Enjoyed the restaurant which even when very busy served breakfast without delay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and ammenities.”
Reviews.Author: erock901
Reviews.Content: We were assigned room 232 first. That room was small and dark. The window was basically covered by a big tree. It also smelled a little smokey. Called the front desk and was moved to 126. This was a great room that open out into the putting green area. The kids loved running around this area. The room was clean, nicely updated and roomy enough to add a small crib. The only negative was the HVAC system. It was very noisy. Actually, it would be quiet for a while but get noisy every few mins. Luckily, my wife and 2yr old daughter were able to sleep through it. Service was great. Since we couldn't have a microwave oven in the room, the front desk staff heated up milk for my daughter every night. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Cannt be locate but Hotel need a renovation”
Reviews.Author: GlobalSShoper
Reviews.Content: Lets start out by saying this location is really good, you get parking, awesome food venues around and relaxing atmosphere, the hotel from the outside looks brand new almost, but when you get in there it looks like you stepped into the twilight zone. When i walked into my room i noticed smoke when it was non smoking, but after calling down front desk apologized and made sure i would not get charged for it. The overall room was a blah, it was sticking and muggy when we got in there, it did not feel fresh. I am a small person but both bathroom doors are small i leave wide ways, so if your big your walking into there side ways. the room did not seem like a Holiday Inn that would you go to, i understand this is an older property but what the hell you still got popcorn ceilings, I just expect a certain kind of ambiance when checking into a Holiday Inn. Overall I would recommend this hotel only for Locate, but if they renovated their hotel rooms, I would not have a problem telling everyone about it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: amandajolly
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotelo by car and the parking was free - we checked into our bedrooms one twin room and one double room - the bedrooms are large with flat screen TV - coffee and tea facilities and we had a fridge in our room. The room was clean and comfortable. Opposite the hotel is the harbour and a fantastic restaurant right opposite hotel with an amazing fire pit which we are now going to build at home. Breakfast was good and the service was excellent - Bell boy helped us book trips and even used mini bus to drop us and pick us up. The hotel is exactly what you pay for is what you get and location is good, service is good and great value - yes i would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location- Great sleep”
Reviews.Author: zorrarojo
Reviews.Content: Great location to airport. Rooms were updated and clean. Staff friendly. Able to print out boarding passes for next day and parking was FREE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just Ok”
Reviews.Author: DunwoodyMom2
Reviews.Content: This hotel could definitely use some updating. The amenities (putt putt & pool) are nice but the rooms were a bit rough.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect holiday hotel”
Reviews.Author: relaxinvernon
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed staying at this hotel. We travelled with our kids aged 4 and 6. The rooms were clean, spacious and well maintained. The beds were great and all of us slept well. The hotel provided vouchers towards breakfast at the adjoining restaurant. The restaurant was great and we used the vouchers towards whatever breakfast we ordered. The hotel had amazing grounds with a putting golf course that was fun for everyone. The pool was fantastic and we lucked out with great weather. We spent many hours in the pool, lounging, playing shuffleboard and snacking from the attached bar. The happy hour was a great perk.

Reviews.Title: “I will stay here every time I visit San Diego. Great Comps!”
Reviews.Author: TCARD
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel. The restaurant was fabulous! I really enjoyed my time here and will come back here every time. Thanks for making my stay so enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “View from our suite was amazing!”
Reviews.Author: didd44
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed here for one night (March 13) and we enjoyed everything about it. The suite had a large bedroom with ensuite beathroom. The living room had a great TV and a comfortable couch. My son said that the oull-out bed was comfortable. The microwave and fridge were welcome additions. The view was right over the marina at the edge of the harbour. The grounds were beautiful with a very clear swimming pool and spa plus table tennis for the sporty types. There were several seafood restaurants nearby. We had to go there because my son has a gluten allergy so we could not eat at the hotel restaurant unfortunately. Maybe, if there are more such travellers with severe allergies, the hotel might consider having specialized menus and changing their kitchen to accommodate them.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding customer service”
Reviews.Author: JohnRIndianapolis
Reviews.Content: When I could not find some souvenier items that I purchased and placed in the room, Hotel manager reimbursed me for the full cost even though it was apparent that nobody had keyed in. Housekeeper was totally honest and the items were not valuable enough that anyone would likely risk stealing them. Manager took me at my word and paid me $68 cash. When the items were later found in the room, the Hotel accepted my apology and would not accept my attempt to pay the money back. It's apparent that customer service is important to the management there. Special kudos to Elizabeth Yunker and Rhinna Meyer.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre facilities and poor service attitude”
Reviews.Author: forestation
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over Christmas with extended family (5 adults in rooms) and spent extra for upgraded rooms. What we got were "Tower" rooms on the fourth floor that overlooked a parking lot and a dug up swimming pool. Worst of all, the rooms (and the whole section of that floor) smelled of smoke -- most likely they were former smoking rooms that were converted to non-smoking rooms by slapping a "no smoking" sign on the doors. The hotel was half full at most -- perhaps they were saving the nicer rooms for Santa Claus and the elves. The general upkeep of the rooms was okay -- the beds were comfortable and there were flat screen TVs, but the furniture was old and worn and the bathrooms probably hadn't been renovated in 20 years. Light sleepers beware -- the hotel is right under the flight path of planes going to and from the nearby airport. That along with the antiquated heating and plumbing system all contribute to a noisy stay. We were supposed to receive free breakfast in the morning as a Priority Club Gold benefit, but originally got only 1 breakfast coupon per room instead of 1 per adult. When I stopped by the front desk to ask for coupons for the 2 additional adults, the front desk agent served me attitude like I was begging her for a favor. When she handed over the coupons she didn't say a single word but just stared at me like she was expecting me to drop to my knees and thank her. Until they renovate the facilities and retrain their staff, I suggest staying somewhere else if you have a choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for our 40th high school reunion!”
Reviews.Author: dgilbreth70
Reviews.Content: We held our Eisenhower High School Class of 1970 40th reunion at the Holiday Inn Bayside in San Diego on November 5th-7th, 2010. Charleene Poissot in sales was our contact, and she was extremely helpful and courteous! The entire staff went out of their way to ensure that our entire group of 100 was satisfied in every way. The banquet was delicious, the service was impeccable, and our every need was met with smiles! Our suite was beautiful and comfortable! The view of the San Diego Bay from every window in our suite was gorgeous! The spaciousness of our suite made it a comfortable place to invite friends in for a drink throughout the weekend. We would highly recommend this hotel for a quiet weekend getaway, or a large gathering such as a wedding or reunion. We fully intend to host our 45th reunion at this hotel, and can trust that we will again be extremely satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Good location lots of parking”
Reviews.Author: Duffnutt09
Reviews.Content: Second stay at this hotel, itâ€™s well located for all attractions and has ample parking. The rooms are spacious well presented and clean. On this visit there seemed to be a number of 'rowdy' guests on our floor with associated late night door banging but this was hardly the Hotels fault (has anyone ever developed the quiet hotel door?) Food was excellent and the service good, reception was a little less friendly than before. Free internet was a real treat.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpectedly good”
Reviews.Author: soj0urner
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here for 3 nights - our last 3 nights in San Diego. We were relocating out of the country for my husband's next assignment. Definitely a welcome comfort after weeks of packing and moving. The 5 of us stayed in a Suite. It was great! Very large living room with a Queen sofa bed and bedroom with 2 Queen beds. There was an LG HDTV the living and bedroom. Very spacious, it could fit all our stuff - about 10 luggages! Beds were very comfortable. Housekeeping was a little slow probably because only 1 staff took care of the whole section. Airconditioning was a little loud but the comfortable room more than made up for it. Our package included breakfast at their restaurant which was ordered from the menu. Excellent food and fantastic portions! The place also wasn't over crowded. Kids ate free. My husband had to complete a report so they gave him a private business lounge to work in for a whole day, complimentary. it was nice - couches, computer, printer, kashi energy bar and fruit was in the room. Free parking, free wifi, free 2hr bicycle rental and complimentary airport shuttle to San Diego airport. It is also facing the marina - you can ride/walk to shelter island on a nice day.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: HT500
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Holiday Inn Bayside many times over the past five years and have never been disappointed. The rooms are a good size, clean, and comfortable. The hotel staff is always friendly and helpful. They really seem to go out of their way to make sure your stay exceeds expectations. For my work, the location of the hotel is ideal, being centrally located between Point Loma and downtown San Diego, as well as a short drive to Old Town. The breakfast at the hotel restaurant is outstanding--some of the best omelets, pancakes, and waffles I have ever had...anywhere. The grounds are very well kept and have a nice tropical feel, especially by the pool and pool-side bar. The bar is very nice and the complimentary drinks are a welcome touch when returning to the hotel from a long day at work. Thank you for a great stay! We will definitely be back to the Holiday Inn Bayside on our next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, lots of palm trees”
Reviews.Author: Peter_Smallhill
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a very good location across the street from marina with a shoreline walkway pleasant for evening walks (several hundred meters in each direction). The hotel is surrounded by many large and small palm trees which creates a resort-like appearance. There are two buildings. Room on the two-story arm face onto a garden area. Rooms in the four-story "tower" have a nice view of palm trees and the marina boats across the street. Rooms are good sized, with typical Holiday Inn bland decorations and standard amenities. My room in the tower was very quiet although the hotel is near San Diego airport. The hotel has a coffee shop which serves good food for all meals and has friendly service. Service in the hotel is generally helpful but occasionally uneven. I had some laundry lost for a day (they helped find it); my room was sometimes cleaned after 4 PM; the hallway had a funny smell which eventually went away. I would still recommend this hotel especially for a business stay due to the location, restful atmosphere, and pleasant coffee shop service.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: SmilingHospitality
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel back in June. I was disappointed as I had received a room that was extremely dated. The bedding, drapes, wall covering were really tired looking. The bath rooms was really tired looking as well. :( I was not happy.....I did not get the room you see in the pictures on the hotels' website. The fridge was a 10 year fridge that made an annoying noise. The central AC was load and the vent was so dirty I didn't want to use it as my wife has respiratory issues. The TV however was a new LCD! Parking at this hotel is a nightmare if you go when it is busy. My overall experience in this room was not good, I felt like they sold me a nice room online but put me in an non-renovated room, not cool when I talked three other of my family members to stay there as well. I was a bit embarrassed as I always stay at IHG hotels and never experience this. Make sure you request a newly remodeled room and not a old room. I wore my tennis shoe all the time in the room as my feel felt like they were going to get dirty from the carpet and tile. I will be uploading pics in the next few days to share my experience.

Reviews.Title: “High priced motel”
Reviews.Author: futrellsmachine
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family about a month ago and after looking at the picture on the website, we are so excited to say here. When we arrived at the hotel, we thought it was a joke. I wouldn't even call this place a hotel, it was more like a motel. So we decided it give it a chance and headed to our pool view room. When we got to the room, we went to the balcony to view the olympic sized pool and Jacuzzi that we had seen on the website and after a couple minutes, we finally found that it was off to the right. Instead we had a pathetic excuse of a golf course view. The pictures made it look like a pro would enjoy his or her time golfing. Maybe my three year old niece would like to learn how to play using that golf course. We decided to go to the jacuzzi and relax after major disapointment and the 6 people that were already there completely took up every inch of the microscopic sad excuse of a jacuzzi. Getting ready in the morning was another issue. Make sure only one person needs to get ready at a time because more than one person wont fit in this bathroom. We complained to management but all they said was "good marketing huh?"

Reviews.Title: “Made my stay in San Diego more enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: clpOhio
Reviews.Content: First Kudos to the shuttle drivers, especially Will and the restaurant staff, a special Kudos to Irene. Stayed here for 1 week, excellent location, rooms were clean, had a room in the inside tower, ok,, if I looked hard right I could see a very tiny bit of the bay, but it was directly across the street. Beds - comfortable, not super firm, but good, lots of pilliows, bedroom was separate from bathroom - very nice, flat screen TV's and good wi-fi service in bedroom Bikes, putt-putt, ping-pong, hot tub, pool and exercise room were great Store - very reasonable prices, comparable to a CVS, well-stocked, very friendly Restaurant - had breakfast there everyday, food was good and there was also some sort of special, prices on food was very good. There are two good seafood places in walking distance, to the right of hotel, a couple of more pricey restaurants directly across the street and to the left about a 10 min or 5 min bike ride there were grocery stores, subway, panera, starbucks and a few other places to eat. Overall staff was friendly, would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the location”
Reviews.Author: PirateEC
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the night before running the AFC half marathon in August. Rate was roughly half of other hotels in the general area & of those marketing to runners. Rooms were adequate for 4 adults for a short stay of 1 night. If staying longer, would definitely need more space & a larger bathroom area. They have a restaurant/bar attached the property, but we opt'd to hit the sushi restaurant up the road. Overall the hotel was clean, convenient & affordable by SD standards.

Reviews.Title: “Very cool!”
Reviews.Author: Genevax
Reviews.Content: My buddy and I came allllll the way to San Diego from...El Cajon & Ramona. Hah! That's only a few miles from San Diego, nothing exotic. A treat none te less to play tourist in our own town and the Holiday Inn San Diego - Bayside was the perfect place for our little sojourn. We stayed in one of the taller bldgs on the 4th floor. Room was refurbished very nicely. Great beds, multiple pillows with soft, firm, etc. Bed were comfortable. Room was nicely decorated and a decent view of the city. Could alllmost see the bay from our room. Bring hair conditioner. There were the usual toiletries available (soap, shampoo, body lotion, shower cap), but no conditioner. Not a big deal. The food at the restaurant was excellent. Service great. Parking free. We had a great rest and fun time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Service!!”
Reviews.Author: KeitaAtlanta
Reviews.Content: This hotel was way above what I expected. Stayed because the confrence I was attending was @ the hotel. Great choice. Staff was friendly, very clean, good food, comfortable room/bed. Will stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Difficult to Dislike This Property - They Try Hard!”
Reviews.Author: DesertExec
Reviews.Content: This is my second visit to this property over the last few years. In all honesty, I wouldn't have chosen it except that ComicCon was the same week and hotels were either full or jacked way up in price. I stayed there three nights and can't really find a bad thing to say...except the fact that my room was at the very back of the hotel and overlooked the parking lot and some low-end apartments. The room was comfortable and clean. Upscale it was not, but good value and perfectly comfortable. The hotel tends to have a musty odor caused by humidity, but I left my slider open quite a bit and it helped a lot. I had no noise issues at all, amazingly. Room service was a big hit for me. Three nights of it and each one excellent. An unexpected delight. Food was delivered quickly and was prepared better than anyone would expect of this type of property. Granted, the saran wrap was a little much, but ensured freshness and the correct temperature. My only small gripe...they don't deliver papers to the door. Even for Gold Members, so every morning I schlepped down to the lobby to get one. Thank God, they always had plenty, so the trips were never in vain. The area of the hotel is a mixed bag, as is much of San Diego once you stray from the tourist areas. It's nice to walk along the harbour and marinas, but go the other way and it's a bit trashy. I do think this hotel is a gem and they try try to please!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased, hotel and restaurant staff have all been very considerate and polite.”
Reviews.Author: JAW25
Reviews.Content: Attending a class held at the hotel. Extremely convenient. Desk, housekeeping, maintenance and restaurant staff have all been very nice. Have frequently ordered room service, food is very good and served hot and in a timely manner.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but can be noisy at times”
Reviews.Author: tonydinardo77
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my wife on our last trip before our baby is born. Very nice room, very clean, large king size bed. Not a fan of exterior doors. Easy in/out on the streets. Free airport shuttle. We were there 5 nights. On day 2, a "gang" of 10 guys in their early 20's booked their room directly above us and it sounded like it was a WWE wrestling match from 6am, all day and all through the night until around 5am. So, needless to say, Out of 5 nights, I slept for 1. This is not a spring break-type hotel either so they were a bit out of place. They would sleep for an hour and then start up again. Finally got our room switched to the "Tower" where things were a bit better and there were interior doors. Staff was average. Did nothing to quiet them down or kick them out. Definitely nice to have a lounge and restaurant on site. Nicely priced drinks. Outgoing bar staff. Nice restaurants across the street near the marina.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, great location, clean - overall pleasant stay!”
Reviews.Author: sgi10
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a week for a conference with work. Was pleasantly surprised by the cleanliness and comfort of the hotel. My room had been remodeled (my colleague was in a room that didn't seem to have been redone yet) and was comfortable and even somewhat stylish. The balcony was a great addition to the room - my view was of the city, but I still used the balcony everyday. Bed was quite comfortable, service was good (with one exception, but it was fixed quickly), fitness facilities were adequate (though stocked with older equipment), location was FANTASTIC. My only compliant was that the internet service was slow during non-peak hours and even slower during peak hours. Overall, I had a very nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service, Location, Price... Bayside Has It All!”
Reviews.Author: BamaRedRaider
Reviews.Content: Brought a small group -- 16 people, 7 rooms -- to the Holiday Inn Bayside and everyone had an absolutely great time. Even though we arrived early, coming back across the border from Ensenada, at 10:30 in the morning, the convention services individual we worked with had all seven of our rooms ready, blocked together, and ready for check-in when we arrived. The facility itself -- conveniently located just a mile or so from the airport -- is exceptional: a restaurant on-site, an outdoor pool, a miniature golf "putting green", a coin-operated laundry. Add the attractions that are within EASY driving distance -- Seaport Village, Old Town and Point Loma -- and you've got the complete package. The Bayside has it all.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff and clean”
Reviews.Author: Peacheskan
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights while visiting family and seeing the zoo and old town. Excellent safe location. Staff great when I was double checking directions. Took less than 10 minutes to get any where we wanted. Just across the street from the harbor so excellent to take a relaxing scenic walk. Room was comfotable and clean! Close to the airport (5 min) but quite.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome staff very nice”
Reviews.Author: nsg2011
Reviews.Content: Holiday Inn San Diego Bayside 4875 North Harbor Drive San Diego, CA 92106 We got there a little early they let us check in instead of making us wait. The lady that checked us in was very nice we also got some coupons for drinks which was awesome if we ever go to San Deigo again we would stay there for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel....value for money”
Reviews.Author: travelbuddy33
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights. The hotel is very nice..they upgraded us to one level higher room as it was my wife's bday. The hotel is very nicely done. rooms are nice..though some renovation would be nice. the location is also nice..we would just walk around it during evening. staff was very courteous. food was a bit pricy..so we would go out for our meals. Overall..would recommend this hotel...

Reviews.Title: “unremarkable stay”
Reviews.Author: dethman
Reviews.Content: stayed at the san diego bayside for a weekend night just for an overnight trip with the SO. check-in was simple enough, and price was average. rooms were spacious, but decor was dated and the couch appeared old and dirty. bed seemed clean, but for some reason i was itching all night, not sure why. bathroom was older and a bit dingy. it fit the bill for that one night, but i probably wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible nights sleep”
Reviews.Author: DaytonOH
Reviews.Content: We came to this hotel for our final night in San Diego because it was closer to the hotel and we thought it would cut down on our morning departure time to the airport (5am). Cost wise, it was only $40 less than what we were paying at the GORGEOUS MARRIOTT ON CORONADO ISLAND. We stayed directly behind the check-in office in the last room at ground level. The room was very cute upon first arrival. I believe it is newly remodeled. However it is quite small. During remodel they must have removed the standard hotel blackout curtains and opted for shutters on their patio door. Due to this the neon lights directly across from us shined into our room all night. It was ridiculous. I complained the next morning and she did not care... at all. I would have expected something like "I'm sorry" or "We'll be sure to look into this." But I just got a stare and then handed my receipt and told to have a nice flight. I will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great 5 days except last morning for check out”
Reviews.Author: manfred66
Reviews.Content: some one hit my rented 2010 white c300 mercedes about $800.00 damage who ever did this i hope they ROT IN HELL

Reviews.Title: “Nothing fancy but pleasant”
Reviews.Author: sumori
Reviews.Content: Traveled from LA to visit the Sea World and used this hotel for a night. There aren't much around the area within the walking distance but it's nice area with a marina near by. And it is close to Sea World so it's a good choice if you are visiting there. The restaurant (The Point Loma CafÃ©) was small, but I was pleasantly surprised to find that the food was quite good. It was nice that the hotel had a little gift shop which carried the basic stuff other than the souvenirs. The pool and the fitness room were open till 11pm, so we were able to use them even after the late check in and the dinner. Nothing special about the staff services, but everything seemed okay. One complaint was that internet speed was so slow, it is hardly usable.

Reviews.Title: “NIce place, comfortable, good food”
Reviews.Author: CohenTheBarbarian
Reviews.Content: This holiday inn is a bit old and not especially visually striking, but the rooms are clean, comfortable and quiet, and everything works well. Free fast internet, big screen TV. The attached restaurant is simple but very good. If you are looking for a nice place to stay, but where the hotel is not the destination, this a an excellent choice. I've stayed here often, and will do so again when I am in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: __travel_girl_ljs__
Reviews.Content: I stayed here only one night on a return trip from Mexico and wanted to be close to the airport. I was pleasantly surprised. First, they have an airport shuttle that starts at 5 AM! Very handy. Second, they have feather pillows available (in addition to the nicely marked hard and soft pillows on the bed). I have never stayed at a hotel that had feather pillows (maybe because I stay in moderately priced hotels), so that was a very nice touch. Third, they had a very nice flat screen TV with a lot of channels (nicer than I had at the Best Western Hacienda). Fourth, they had a mini-fridge that was cold and was not stocked with expensive items I was afraid to touch or I might get charged. Fifth, they have a little business center where you can print out your boarding pass. Sixth, excellent service. I had left my purse--with passport, boarding pass, everything--on the airport shuttle bus. At the airport, I had no idea where I had left it. I frantically called the hotel--the front desk person put me on hold until she talked to the shuttle bus driver who found my purse and delivered it to me at the airport. Thanks very much! You saved my trip.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location - makes it worth the price.”
Reviews.Author: gustynpip
Reviews.Content: The room was very basic, including bathroom and amenities. But the location could not have been better. It was very close to lots to do, and the view of the ocean and Coronado Island was wonderful. Had a little balcony where you could sit and enjoy it. Staff was friendly. Had a lovely little gift shop. All in all, a basic visit, but since one spends little time in a hotel room when in San Diego, it provides the perfect stop off spot. My one complaint was that they charged us for parking when we didn't really have a car, and never mentioned the charge until we received the bill. We did ask for a parking pass because a friend who lives there let us use her car during the day, and we needed to park it for an hour or two a couple of days. The last day, we rented a car to begin the rest of our trip. We were charged $22 for each of the first days, when we perhaps used the parking area for a total of two hours a day, max, and $44 dollars for the last day, when we parked one car overnight. No mention was made when being given the parking pass that we'd be charged anything, and I thought it was included with the room. Otherwise, we'd just have parked in public parking for the little we used it. So other than the unexpected $110 in charges, our experience was good.

Reviews.Title: “A mini resort on a budget”
Reviews.Author: macaroni2go
Reviews.Content: Based on the Trip Advisor review we stayed here five nights pre-cruise late January, and it was an excellent choice. We got a great rate from Entertainment Book, which was not a pre-paid deal. We could cancel 24 hours prior to arrival. Two other couples staying with us had cars, and parking was free for them. We called from the Tourist Information stand at the airport, and the hotelâ€™s shuttle arrived within 15 minutes. We got a king room on the 3rd floor on the second building. The room was nice but the bathroom was not updated. We changed to another room on the same floor in the first building (corridors connect the two sections), which had an updated bathroom as well as a less obstructed view. We could also get fresh air by opening a lever under the window. If you are a Priority Club member, you get coupons for two free drinks per night (from the bar or dining room). If you are a higher level member you get free breakfast. That, along with Happy Hour Monday to Friday munchies were pleasant surprises. The grounds are well kept and nicer than the hotel pictures show. It felt like a â€œmini resort on a budgetâ€�. Nice pool, hot tub, ping pong, shuffleboard, bicycles, internet â€“ all free. This area (Point Loma) is quiet and relaxing. We walked along the shore all the way to Shelter Island, then along the sandy beach with great view of the San Diego skyline. We dined at Pizza Nova, Point Loma Seafood, and Point Loma CafÃ© - all very close. We also walked (about 20 minutes) to Liberty Station, enjoyed dinner at Sammyâ€™s Wood-fired Pizza and bought some groceries at Trader Joeâ€™s and Vons. Itâ€™s also a short walk to the #28 bus on Rosecrans, buy a $5 day pass, and roam the entire transit system (buses and 3 trolley lines). The Entertainment Book included a number of coupons for restaurants in the area not to mention a $13 coupon for Point Loma CafÃ© associated with the hotel. All the dishes were tried were very good and the service prompt. After sundown the area is very quiet, so if youâ€™re looking for active nightlife, stay in Gaslight, which we did post-cruise for two nights. On the morning of our cruise we took the 1:00pm free shuttle to the port. Much was said about the friendly staff â€“ itâ€™s all true and a real pleasure to experience in person

Reviews.Title: “Decent with great views”
Reviews.Author: Seajax
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights with a colleague. We both were given king sized rooms on the 5th floor with balconys. The views were spectacular. She had a view of the homes on the hillsides and I had a view of downtown San Diego in the distance. It was an average room with a small desk and a refrigerator under the TV. We didn't realize there was a fridge until the morning we were leaving, otherwise I would have brought some water to keep chilled. The room comes with a coffee maker, sub-standard coffee, hair dryer and an iron & ironing board in the small closet. There wasn't anything spectacular about the room, but nothing terrible either. I only have two minor complaints. 1: the air vent was constantly rattling and I couldn't sleep the first night. I didn't even have the fan or air on so I don't know what that was about. 2: the TV never had a clear picture regardless of the channel. My colleague's TV was fuzzy also (like reception with the old rabbit ears), so it must have just been the way the whole hotel gets their TV. There was a shuttle to the nearby airport, but I never took it as we drove from LA. Parking at the Holiday Inn is free, so that was nice compared to other hotels in the city. Even though the hotel is near the airport, I never heard any planes, so I don't believe they fly over the hotel. The convention center is 4.5 miles away and costs $10 to park there. Beware, you can't exit and return to the convention center without paying again. You pay every time you enter, so you can't eave for the day and return without paying another $10. Overall, this was an average hotel that is clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Bayside”
Reviews.Author: Phargo
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Its nothing fancy, just a Holiday Inn. The bell hops were awesome and provided some rides to local places for a tip even when they were not required to do so. The desk people were pretty accurate for some good places to eat as well.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent decision!”
Reviews.Author: paulseattle
Reviews.Content: stayed with Mom, sisters, and a nephew, in order to watch my nephew graduate from MCRD; of course, I extensively researched hotels. We originally reserved La Quinta in Mission Valley; but after several actual phone calls I decided on Holiday Inn and we were very happy for the following reasons: front desk was unfailingly courteous and professional; the free shuttle drivers were friendly and very punctual; we always felt safe and valued (I talked to both night security--one was a Iraqi vet who sustained injuries from an IED); the wonderful food at the Point Loma cafe was always fresh and plentiful (excellent service also); the rooms were spotless and the beds were like heaven; and when I had a little glitch the management went all out to resolve the issue! AAA discount too! I highly recommend this fine hotel (Gaslamp only minutes away, minutes to the airport, and 15 minutes to Mission Beach). Felt valued, felt respected, felt very comfortable staying here; and we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased with Holiday Inn Bayside”
Reviews.Author: NittanyLee
Reviews.Content: Never being to San Diego before, we knew nothing about where to stay. After looking at several sites, I narrowed it down to a few places. Then I went to Trip Advisor to read the reviews. We decided on the Holiday Inn Bayside. Of course, we would be there 6 nights so I knew we could move if we were not happy. We decided to use public transportation since we didn't know our way around. The bus stop is only 2 blocks from the hotel. Also within walking distance is a Winchell's Donuts, Denny's, McDonald's, Der Wienerschnitzel, and Pizza Nova. There is also a KFC - but I would not recommend it (it was dirty and they seemed to not know what they were doing). There is also a nice restaurant at the hotel, Point Loma Cafe. The hotel offers complimentary airport transportation and wi-fi as well as a pool and hot tub. The room itself was comfortable and the pillows were great. The room was clean and there were plenty of towels and our room had a huge window with a nice view. The kids enjoyed the 9 hole put-put course and the ping-pong table (free to guests). There is also a business center with 2 computers with printers available for guest use. The staff were all very friendly. All in all, I would certainly recommend this hotel. We were only 4-5 miles from Mission Beach, Sea World, Liberty Station and Old Town. If we go back to San Diego, I will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect base for a relaxing holiday”
Reviews.Author: fozzibearr
Reviews.Content: Arriving at the hotel after over 20 hours travelling I was exhausted, missing a suitcase and just wanted to hide in a corner. I was checking in at the front desk and was told I'd been allocated a non-smoking room as my preference hadn't been passed on by my travel agent at which point I thought karma was biting back. The man on the desk was extremely helpful and switched me to a smoking room with no trouble at all and when I explained that my suitcase would possibly be delivered to the hotel that night again there was no problem and he said they would call if this happened. I got to my room which was good sized, very clean, and the bed was heavenly, fantastic memory foam mattress and they do indeed give you a range of pillows to choose from - for the sleep deprived this was a gift from the gods. Fell into such a deep sleep that when I woke in the morning I realised I had missed a call - woohoo my suitcase was here. Went to the front desk to collect the case and to put my passport and what not in the safe, couldn't have asked for more friendly and helpful assistance. The Point Loma Cafe was my next stop for breakfast - All the people there are fantastic, everyone is quick with a smile and extremely efficient. The French Toast is to die for and ended up being my only brekkie choice, portions are large and things are extremely well priced. Used it a couple of times for dinner both for sitting in and room service - for a picky eater like me this is indeed high praise. A huge thank you to everyone in the Point Loma Cafe for their contribution to my fantastic mornings. I used the free internet access regularly and didn't experience any problems accessing or lagging when I was online and I was using it from my room, the cafe, car park, etc. There were several sections of the car park, all of which were spacious and well lit so although female and travelling alone I wasn't wary of parking and walking to my room, I even got a call one night from security to let me know I had left on my interior light, I can only imagine my face if they hadn't contacted me and I had a flat battery the next morning. I booked this hotel due to its proximity to the Zoo and Sea World and I wasn't disappointed, it took less than ten minutes to drive to either from the hotel. I was delighted that I could opt into the good housekeeping scheme and leave a card on the bed to say that I didn't need my bedding or towels changed every night, this is a great scheme but I was happy that it was optional and there was no pressure to participate. If you are staying here and have the chance I would also recommend Seaport Village which is just along the beautiful harbor drive, less than a ten minute drive, and the Seal Tour on their Amphibious Bus is great fun. Would I go back here? In a heartbeat. I think people sometimes underestimate the value of fantastic staff and here I didn't meet anyone who wouldn't merit the full 5 stars. I have to say though that Carlos in the Cafe gets an extra special star because he was so pleasant and remembered what I had the day before which amazed me.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular View”
Reviews.Author: RobbieL
Reviews.Content: I was on a one-night business trip and fell in love with this hotel. The view of the bay was great! I recommend this location highly!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Facility but....”
Reviews.Author: JDL12424
Reviews.Content: We spent a weekend in San Diego making arrangements for my son's wedding next April. We chose the Holiday Inn - Bayside because it is the closest ICH Facility to Shelter Island and the wedding hotel. I am a Priority Club member with ICH and prefer to use their hotels when possible. This is a large and spreadout facility.
