We were given what I assumed to be a premium room on the fourth floor of the tower building although being on the other side of the hallway and having a bay view instead of seeing the parking lot would have been nice. We only ate breadfast in the hotel as our days were busy and found it to be better than most Holiday Inn Restaurants. Overall we had a pleasant experience with the hotel. The housekeeping staff seemed to be very limited in their ability to converse in English, about equal to my command of Spanish but we managed to make ourselves understood. The only concern and aggrevation I had was our neighbors across the hall. There were people in and out of the room continuously all night long each of the three nights we stayed there and they did not seem to care how many times the door slammed. Daytimes a Do Not Disturb sign hung on the door. (Yes I was tempted) Nocturnal activity of this type in a hotel normally leads me to believe that there may be some sort of illegal activities occuring. This is not what I expect of the upper floors of a Holiday Inn in a seemingly upscale neighborhood. Perhaps they have higher class criminals than we have in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic weekend”
Reviews.Author: eph2004
Reviews.Content: We pick this hotel on expedia, we really enjoyed our very, very confortable stay; nice clean room. We had read the reviews of fwy noise but not so since we would get there late and go straight to bed. Our weekend in SD was for our son's 4th bdy, we did the who Sea Wrold, SD Zoo, Wild Animal Park, Trolley Tour(highly recomend the trolley takes you all over and you get to stop at all the interesting points and board off & on all day, very well worth what you pay for this tour), Coronado Island, I almost forgot my son's favorite Seal Tour, SeaPort Village, Maritime Museum & other museums at Balboa Park. Overall lots to do in small SD. We were exhausted but relaxed an extra day before starting our week back to work. We will be going back to SeaWorld before Dec 31, 2009 since we had the 2day pass and only used 1 day. We will be staying at the same SD Holiday Inn again. Very please with our weekend, never thought it would turn out with so much to do...good thing I had kind of an agenda.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant hotel, courteous staff”
Reviews.Author: scopie100
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for business with a number of colleagues from the UK. The staff were all very polite and a quick and efficient checking in process followed. The rooms are all big and mine had 2 queen size beds! I was overlooking the pool and small putting green. You might end up in a room there or one in the main 5 storey block. The facilities are all ok, pool, bar, restaurant, shop etc. Breakfast is ok, and i use that lightly. I felt service at breakfast wasn't great and i was there a week. The bar staff were good and I was shocked to find they had stella on tap, a priceless commodity for brits travelling! Oh and the barmaid was lovely! The rooms were a good size, massive tv, good bathroom and all was cleaned daily. There is free wireless which helped on an evening whilst doing work. Across the road was the harbour and a few restaurants so choice a plenty. Taxi ride to central San diego, the gas lamp qtr, is about $18. This is where you will find all the nightlife you need! In summary a pleasant hotel with nice staff.

Reviews.Title: “pretty decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: thesnurgs
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently and they were very helpful. They will pick you up and take you back on their shuttle. The staff was friendly and the room was fine. They have a nice little pool, restaurant and bar area, also they have two computers that you can use for free. Overall it was a good place to stay if you aren't looking for a lot of nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient location”
Reviews.Author: grlips
Reviews.Content: In San Diego for Marine Corps Graduation at MCRD San Diego. This hotel is very close to the base. Close to shopping, restaurants and sightseeing. Price was a bit high for what you get, but it was clean and safe. Room was average. They have van transportation to the base, if needed. Close to Cabrillo National Monument park, which I highly recommend visiting. The views of San Diego Bay and the Pacific Coast are spectacular. Office staff was helpful. Decent fitness center. Gary L

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad for Price and Location”
Reviews.Author: menypen
Reviews.Content: This hotel was okay. The rooms were comfortable and clean, but not spotless. Our drains were slow and the bath area was cramped. We were in a convenient location and the parking was free, which is not common. There was a bottle store on the grounds which carried snacks and drinks, which was very convenient. The attached restaurant was nice and had quick service. There were bicycles that could be checked out and a shuffleboard and ping pong table by the pool. The pool was kind of small. For the price, I think this hotel was perfectly fine, but I would probably try another one next visit just for a change of pace.

Reviews.Title: “Free Breakfast??”
Reviews.Author: Dave194282
Reviews.Content: The breakfast was provided in a separate building adjacent to the hotel. We were there 4 nights and we attended breakfast on first 3 (Gave up after then). None of the tables had been cleaned away and the choice was the worst experienced in a Best Western Also the garage space ($10 a day) was inadequate for the number of rooms and became full early in the evening. The bedroom service was variable, sometimes soaps and shampoos replaced on others not.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: MissChrisPhoenix_AZ
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from our 5 day stay at this hotel and we were pleased with just about everything. The location was great with the major attractions in San Diego just a short car ride away. The Free Parking was fabulous! That perk really adds to the appeal of this hotel as it is a real money saver. Our guest room seemed to have been recently updated and was very clean. We had a flat screen T.V., very comfortable beds and a terrific view of the marina. The bathroom is a bit small, especially when you have a family of 4 in the room, but if was functional. My husband and kids especially liked the pool area with the ping pong table and putting green. If you like to play ping pong and have your own paddles and balls I would advise bringing them as people do not always return the loaner equipment when they are supposed to. The only negative of our stay was upon check in when we found out we were not on the top floor of the building. We like the top floor since we do not want to hear people above us and, when my husband made the reservation he was told our room was on the top floor. It wasn't. It was on the 4th floor and there are 5 floors in this hotel. Luckily we didn't have any problems with noisy people above us. The elevator (yes, in our area there was only one) was quite slow. All in all we would definitely consider staying there again and the few minor inconveniences were really outweighed by the things we liked.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT family hotel”
Reviews.Author: nicki_dColorado
Reviews.Content: This was a great pick for our family of five (2A, 3K, age 11, 11, and 12). They had lots to do (ping pong, huge lawn, shuffle board, a hot hot tub, mini golf, and friendly staff and a clean room. They gave us complimentary drink coupons and had a great breakfast-which our kids ate free. The kids meals were very large-more than the menu implies! Dinner was a little pricey and we only ate there once. This will be our choice next time we visit.

Reviews.Title: “Our non smoking room smelled like thick cigarette smoke odor”
Reviews.Author: Campdaddy
Reviews.Content: The moment that we walked into our non smoking room, we smelled the bad odor of cigarette smoke. We had to open our sliding door to let some air in. When we called the front desk to complain, they said that there was no other rooms available. Later the hotel sent a housekeeping lady to spray some air freshioner in our room. It helped with the cigarette odor but I was still coughing all night. I also found a lot of dust on the floor behind the television. This room seemed to need a complete remodel. The bathroom fan sounded like a "Harley Davidson". We were afraid that we would wake everyone in the hotel from the noise that this fan made. This room was so bad that I felt embarrased for the hotel. However the staff at the hotel was friendly and the pool and jacuzzi was nice and clean. Their restaurant had great food and this make our stay more appealing.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and Accomodating”
Reviews.Author: Naynay56
Reviews.Content: Four members of our family recently booked a week at Holiday Inn Bayside. It was my husband's and my first time in San Diego. We were "blown-away" by the friendly, professional staff, beauty and comfort of the room, and exceptional services available at this facility. Everything was, "No Problem". They helped with transportation, restuarant and site-seeing recommendations, etc. We asked about renting a couple of bikes but they had them available to us for free. The pool and spa was immaculate with plenty of clean pool towels available. The on-site resturant was very good as well. A special "thank you" to Jodie for going out of her way to make our stay so special. If we ever get another chance to get back to San Diego, we will be sure to stay at this wonderful resort.

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest Staff in Town”
Reviews.Author: Rab0
Reviews.Content: We were complete stangers to mass transit but with the help of the Holiday Inn Bayside, we were able to easily navigate our way to the transit store to buy an extended transit pass for a fraction of the cost of a car rental or taxi. The pass allowed us to get on and off as many times a day as we needed without the worry of having the correct amount of money to pay the bus fare. You can travel almost anywhere in and around San Diego you want to go with the use of their transit system. Have I mentioned yet how friendly EVERYONE in San Diego is and how helpful they are. We must have had tourist written all over us because everyone was eager to help us get where we needed to go. The staff at the Holiday Inn Bayside are happy to help you get where you need to go using the transit system, just ask them and they will work with you. Did I mention how clean the hotel is and how well maintained this property is. Yes, we will stay here again on our next travel to San Diego. Keep up the good work Holiday Inn Bayside, you are tops on our list of places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Hotel with a tropical feeling.”
Reviews.Author: atemple1087
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the airport and requested a shuttle. They told us it would be about 15 minutes. They were right on time and the driver was very informative. He let us know of everything there was to do in the area. The staff at the hotel and restaurant were very friendly and helpful. We only planned on staying one night before we went to Mexico but stayed for 2 instead. The pool and spa were awesome. we would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelizsisters
Reviews.Content: We spent one night here b/c our flight was oversold. Very friendly and helpful staff + nice restaurant. Room was good size and beds were really comfortable. Good location if you have a vehicle. If using public transportation it might present a challenge. There seemed to be lots of families staying here.

Reviews.Title: “We had a fabulous stay at the Holiday Inn Bayside... lovely suite, great food, nice golf & pool!”
Reviews.Author: HolmesSanDiego_CA
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at San Diego's Holiday Inn Bayside. We were made to feel very welcome with a nice fruit and wine platter waiting for us when we checked in. The view of the boats and the Bay were just breathtaking. The location is extremely convenient, and the staff was friendly and helpful. Our family always enjoys the miniature golf course, the pool and the other deck games. We have stayed at this Holiday Inn many times and cannot recommend it highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay with children or without! We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: tkswaff
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a suite with 3 kids. The amenities were wonderful. Pool, jacuzzi, Putt putt golf, pool table, and bikes to ride for free. We've taken many trips to San Diego and love to stay here. It's close to everything but also has a lot of amenities if you don't want to leave. We rode bikes (that the hotel provided) for 2 days. The new Liberty Station is great place to ride or drive to. Make sure to visit the candle factory for unique gifts. The hotel has a great shop on location also. The hotel was very clean and the staff was wonderful. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn Bayside was very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: CathyWolf
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Bayside for one night before a cruise with a group of several friends. The hotel was very comfortable, our room was very nice and very clean, bed very comfortable. The front desk people were very accommodating. The hotel has a very nice pool area and a mini-golf. The bar was very fun (of course most of it was our group!), the bartender was very patient with our large group and said we were fun. The restaurant was good, we had dinner and breakfast there. Several in our group used the shuttle to the cruise port with no issues at all. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible place”
Reviews.Author: scicarus
Reviews.Content: Buildings are worn out. Rooms are tiny. Amenities are old. I got a room with ventillation noise so loud that kept me up all night. There is not a single thing that I liked about this hotel. If you want to sleep, go somewhere else. This is a horrible horrible place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Mariposa1020
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel before and was the reason I chose it again. I stayed in a poolside room which was newly renovated and quite large. My parents stayed in another building, the room was smaller and not as nice but they had a wonderful balcony with a beautiful view of the marina and city. They stayed for a week and were very pleased with everything. The hotel was very clean, well kept, and staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel is located in Point Loma which is on the other side of the airport but is a quiet area with no charges for parking (a HUGE bonus for this area). So basically you are within a 5 minute drive to any freeway via Rosecrans and less than 10 minutes to downtown. I would definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Looks tired and worn out”
Reviews.Author: spendkidsinheritance
Reviews.Content: We arrrived, to be told to take our bags through the pool area which was opening and closing 2 gates,(our first key card did not work), then up a flight of stairs, no lift access, to the end of a dark corridor open to the weather. No help offered.The room really smelt awful and was dirty and stuffy. When I complained there was no hesitation in finding us a more suitable room in the newer part of the hotel, much better. Restaurant very reasonable and the food was good. Good bus access to the town and a great seafood place across the road.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but...”
Reviews.Author: Strathallan
Reviews.Content: An adequate hotel for an overnight stay prior to an early a.m. flight from San Diego Airport, which is just a short distance away. The hotel seems tired - possibly it just has to cope with a lot of wear and tear. Unfortunately a top-floor room was directly beneath an A/C unit, and adjacent to a lift-shaft, and the continuous noise meant that sleep was impossible. The on-site restaurant was of a reasonable standard.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but location not great”
Reviews.Author: RoulstonFamily
Reviews.Content: This is a fairly decent hotel - rooms were clean and functional but nothing flash - more or less what we had expected. Offers good amenities with a great restaurant adjacent and pool area with shuffle board, putting green and table tennis. Staff were helpful and friendly. Location not great but I think you need a car in San Diego anyway as it's pretty spread out.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Close to the Airport”
Reviews.Author: loves NC
Reviews.Content: On January 25, 2008 we were traveling from North Carolina to Hawaii & since the flight is so long, wanted to stay overnight before heading out for Hawaii. After checking flights on the internet, found it was cheaper to fly into San Diego than LAX. Glad we did. San Diego is a smaller airport with friendly service. I booked the Holiday Inn Bayside after reading the good reviews on Trip Advisor & because they have a free 24 hour shuttle service. The Information Desk at the airport contacted the hotel for us & our driver was there quickly. The hotel is about 1 1/2 miles from the airport. Hotel check-in was handled efficiently & the gentleman at the desk was very nice. They have a restaurant next door & we were given free drink coupons. We asked for other eating options in the area that we could walk to & he recommended 2 pizza restaurants. We decided on the one across the street. The pizza was delicious. The hotel also offers for guests a business room with 2 computers & printers where we were able to print out our boarding passes for the next day. Our room was comfortable & clean. Nice thick fluffy towels & extra pillows. I would definitely recommend this hotel. In fact, we also stayed here on our return trip home from Hawaii.

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service for a New Marine's Family”
Reviews.Author: ThriftmasterM
Reviews.Content: On a recent trip to the San Diego Marine Corps Recruit Depot to attend a graduation, we booked the kid's suite at the Holiday Inn Bayside. After spending the first night in the room, we were not pleased with that particular accomodation. The kids' suite Jungle Room was really intended for younger children. We called the front desk to ask for a change and they UPGRADED US TO A FABULOUS two-room suite at no extra charge! Also, the heated pool at this hotel is really nice, along with a spa, shuffleboard, a weight room, ping pong...the cocktail lounge and the Bayside restaurant were also very pleasant features of this Holiday Inn location. We also ordered room service and it was delivered on time with a smile.The Nintendo game console was out of commission in our room, but the engineering tech made sure he got to the bottom of the problem and in a couple of hours, the problem was fixed. A great experience! Highly recommended especially for the excellent customer service. Thanks so much for a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “quiet, clean, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: barbiflys
Reviews.Content: Stayed there twice in December for work. I enjoyed the comfortable beds and the very quiet area. The hotel is spread out enough that even the parties that were held in the ballrooms on new years eve were far enough from my room so that I was able to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “not a convenient location for toursits”
Reviews.Author: canadabound
Reviews.Content: there are 2 holiday Inns with similar names the other one is Holiday Inn on the Bay.Some reviews on this site have obviously confused the two,this one is not near a railway and definitely not walking distance to the Gaslamp quarter In fact it is difficult to access areas of interest as it is too far out of San Diego downtown and not on a metro line.The hotel gives good driving directions to areas of interest but parking is a nightmare in Old Town and expensive at Seaport Village unless you spend money in the gift shops to get your parking validated[tourist trap-only visit to access the very good Seals tour-amphibious vehicle which takes you out on a tour on the bay] The hotel was in the process of repainting the corridoors while we were there but they were using the same dingy colours-it needs brightening up! We stayed on the best for breakfast rate which included a $20 voucher to be spent in the restaurant.This paid for about half the cost for 2 adults and 2 teenagers-we didn't eat there in the evenings-recommend Oggis pizza and brewing company - left out of the hotel and 1/4 mile along the road. The pool was good with extra activities around it such as table tennis,shuffleboard and a putting green. The main point against this hotel was the location,if you are a tourist wanting access to the sights stay downtown or at a hotel on the metro line

Reviews.Title: “Last Minute Hotel Change Resulted in a Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: stgcskeith
Reviews.Content: My recent stay was the result of a business trip. I had reservations at a different hotel nearby, but was concerned with the accomodations based on reviews from this site. Taking a chance, I called Holiday Inn the day I needed to check in for a reservation. Fortunately there were rooms available at a competitive government rate. After a lenghty flight delay, I finally arrived at the hotel around 2:00 a.m. The night desk clerk was waiting for me to arrive and expeditiously handled my check in. I found the entire staff's customer service and professionalism to be excellent to outstanding. The room far exceeded my expectations. It was well appointed for a business traveller, clean, and comfortable. It is obvious this is an older hotel, but one that received a well accomplished renovation. Room cleanlines remained outstanding during my three day stay. As a Priority Club Member, I was able to delay checking out until 2:00 p.m. to fit my red-eye travel a bit more comfortably. One nice surprise was the $20.00 breakfast cupon for the hotel restaraunt. The hotel is located sufficiently close enough to Sheler Island that I could walk with in 5-10 minutes to a variety of decent restaraunts. Overall I thought this was a great place to stay. I would definitely recommend staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Pnl33
Reviews.Content: Perfect family hotel, located near Seaworld (less than 10 minutes drive!). We stayed here this summer and everything was perfect, nice swimmingpool, beautiful garden and a friendly staff. Just perfect for a nice stay in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Nice quiet hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Suzanne
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Bayside while attending a wedding at Point Loma. The location could not have been better! We arrived in San Diego by Amtrak. The hotel provides free shuttle service to the hotel which is nice. We originally checked into a room on the 4th floor which did not have windows that opened. We are fresh air people, so asked if they had any balcony rooms. We were promptly moved to a room in the two story building which had a balcony overlooking the putting green/pool area. Wonderful! It was a good size room and we spent many hours on the balcony. We had breakfast at the restaurant which was very good. Our waitress was efficient and very friendly. The staff at this hotel was wonderful! Everyone we came in contact with was courteous, professional and very friendly. This is a nice, quiet, family friendly resort. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location and big room”
Reviews.Author: hmweis1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel from 6/11-6/14 for business. It was pretty nice. The lobby was pretty fancy and the person at the front desk was very friendly. My room was a lot larger than I expected, but I asked for a fridge and about all you could fit in there would be a six pack. The bathroom was kind of small and the bathtub and faucet were old and the water was hard to turn on/off. The hotel itself was very cozy and the bed was very comfortable. The pool area was nice with clean towels on all of the lounge chairs. I would recommend staying here when visiting San Diego if you're looking for a budget-friendly hotel in a decent area of town.

Reviews.Title: “Lacking on every front.”
Reviews.Author: JesseLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: The hallways in the part of the motel we were put in - the 3rd floor - smelled terrible. Like sweat, gym socks, maybe previous pet visitors. We paid extra for a "kid's suite" which is nothing more than a normal sized room with the second queen bed removed and a partition put around bunk beds and a desk with a TV and VCR. The partitions weren't even floor to ceiling and there was no door so we were not only concerned that the light from beside our bed kept the kids awake - but we couldn't watch our own television because they had a clear view of it. We don't allow them access to adult programs and by that I only mean "regular" programing, since our children are all under eight. The attached restaurant was slow, overpriced and unspectacular all around. We had no view but the best available was only of docked boats in a crowded harbor across a busy multi-laned street. The walk we took didn't bring us into contact with anything of interest or even a diversion. The maids left our half full glasses of water and shorted us clean glasses. I gave the motel an "okay, with problems" instead of "terrible" because I suppose it's possible we were in an 'older section' or one that's been allowed to become run down since pets are allowed. Then again, I don't know if that would account for that stale, dirty sock smell that hits you the moment you step out of the elevator. No problems with staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good family hotel”
Reviews.Author: ahagen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night at the beginning of our western vacation. My kids wished we stayed here longer! We were upgraded to a suite when we arrived (we are regular priority club members). It was very large and comfortable. The woman at the front desk at check in was wonderful. This hotel is older and a typical Holiday Inn but it had everything we wanted. We used the 9 hole putting green which was fun and the fitness center which was adequate. The pool looked nice but it was too cold to get in. The location is great for the price. Don't confuse it with Holiday Inn at the Bay which is the other way from the Airport on Harbor Blvd. We ended up there first (and took our suitcases out!) before we realized our mistake. They told us it was a common mistake. That Holiday Inn is definitely fancier with a better view of the harbor but we were plenty happy with this one. It is a good find for the price.

Reviews.Title: “This is a Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SandboxHockey
Reviews.Content: I always read the reviews of hotels on Trip Advisor before I book a hotel room when traveling. The Holiday Inn Bayside is a good hotel to stay at with a family. There is plenty to do at the hotel for the kids. The pool is average size but clean. There is ping-pong, shuffleboard, a pool table, bikes, and a nice little 9 hole putting green on the grounds. The exercise room is clean and has good equipment. The grounds of the hotel are nice as well. The restaurant was excellent. The coupons for breakfast is good for up to $20 per day. So for a family of four, the coupon will not cover an entire breakfast. Therefore, breakfast really wasn't free, but it was still a good deal. There is construction going on at this hotel, but if you ask the front desk staff to keep you away from the construction they will accomodate you. We never really noticed the construction during our stay. Nice queen sized beds with lots of pillows. There is a marina across the street and we did have a nice view of it from our window even though it was not a direct view. They also have FREE wireless internet service and FREE parking. We just moved from the Handlery Hotel on Hotel Circle and are pleased that we did.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel/Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BAFeller
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Bayside on Friday, March 2nd. We were very pleased with the service--right from the start they came to pick us up at the airport (Reuben the van driver was great!). Our room wasn't ready when we got there at 12:00 p.m. so we walked down to Shelter Island--beautiful day 70 degrees. Reuben suggested that we eat at the Point Loma Seafood Deli about 4 blocks from the hotel which we did on our way back from Shelter Island--all fish was fresh and excellent. Prices were very reasonable. When we got back to the Holiday Inn we found that we had been upgraded to a suite. It was huge and very nice. The outdoor pool and whirlpool are heated to very comfortable temperatures. The grounds are very well kept and pool area has beautiful palm trees and foliage. In the morning we ate at the Point Loma Cafe next to the hotel for breakfast--it very good and reasonable. We were then shuttled over to the cruise line by our driver Reuben (don't forget to tip Reuben--he does a great job). All in all it was a great hotel and everyone was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “It was about average....”
Reviews.Author: ivorysalmon
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 days at the Bayside; was there for conference, so decided to stay for convenience. Room was on 3rd floor above conference floors; it was very clean and comfortable, altho the entryway and bathroom areas were abit cramped. Restaurant on premises was abit pricey, but because there is nothing very close by, you are a 'captive audience'. Food was pretty good; as part of Holiday Inn's "Rewards"-type program, I received a $20 off breakfast (per day) coupon, which came in very handy! Pizza Nova across the street was tasty; try their lunch special (pizza or pasta and a salad). Otherwise, can be abit pricey, but beautiful view of the marina. Further up a block, is Point Loma Seafood. The most beautiful fresh fish I have ever seen! They have a 'sushi bar' which will make some selections for you to enjoy on the patio, plus they have seafood to order to takeout. Nothing fancy, but it was packed at lunch! They have fish, clams, shrimp, crab, calamari, etc., of which you can have in a sandwich, on a platter, in a salad, or in a taco, with sides of fried, onion rings, cole slaw, etc. Had the Boston chowder in a breadbowl for lunch, then walked back for a calamari plate dinner. Fresh, tender calamari strips were delicious! And, for less than $9.00, a great deal! Had I known this was so close, I would have come the previous day and tried more on the menu. They also have smoked fish that you can have on a sandwich or buy to take with you. We heard the line is out the parking lot at lunchtime and I believe it! Well worth the trip tho, IMO. Propertywise, the Bayside is finishing up some upgrades; i didn't see/use the pool or putting green. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Pluses? Free shuttle to airport, $20 off breakfast (Rewards club perk), great staff. Minuses? Pricey coffee shop on premises, rooms abit small. Would I return? Yes, but I would checkout their sister property nearby at Humphrey's.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Bayside”
Reviews.Author: JoyousTraveller
Reviews.Content: We spent 7 nights at the Bayside during the final week of December. Our hotel was perfect for our needs, and is only a few minutes from the airport. We were on the 5th floor, with a view of the Bay, and it was quite quiet. The mattress was very comfortable. We appreciated the many extras e.g. free parking, weekday newspapers, free safety deposit box for our passports, weight/health room, small fridge to store our snacks for breakfast, nine hole putting etc. The staff were very helpful and polite on all matters. When we booked for various tours, the cost was always a few dollars less with extras e.g. Sea World we paid a few dollars less than the cost of 1 day and received a 2 day pass. At $52 a person U.S. that means something. The front desk also provides a double-sided page listing clear directions for driving to 23 points of interest to the tourist. The connecting restaurant, Point Loma Cafe, while looking average, had outstanding food and service, and at very reasonable cost. The excellent trolley bus tour of San Diego had a pick up outside of our hotel. We will definitely be returning. By the way, we chose this hotel after reading many reviews for several hotels on Trip Advisor.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: whodking
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the San Diego Holiday Inn Bayside for two night in November 2006. The location is perfect. We have stayed near hotel circle, dowtown, old town, etc., but this location is quieter and less congested. The hotel check in was easy enough. We had the option of staying in the tower or in a larger room with balcony in the "garden" buildings. We opted for the larger room. The garden rooms have no elevator, which wasn't a big deal. Parking is a bit tough at night. The room was pretty basic and needed and update. The beds were very firm, which wasn't good. The room was fairly clean, but we noticed a few dirty walls and the bathroom floor could have been better. The doors were tight, so our neighbors had to slam them to get them shut. Not fun at 3 a.m.! We tried the restaurant for dessert. Not bad, but too pricey. The location is perfect though. Try Pizza Nova across the street. Great food, good prices, great view. Also, Point Loma Seafood is a few blocks away and is the best seafood I've had. Overall, we would stay at the HI Bayside again, but request a tower room.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: LeePee24
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a good location and depending what side your room is on the views can either be great are quite boring. The view over the water is stunning and seeing all the ships too is lovely. San Diego is such a beautiful place to visit and I loved it. The hotel fulfilled our needs, was clean and rooms were fine.

HotelInfo.Name: Holiday Inn San Diego-Bayside
HotelInfo.Address: 4875 N. Harbor Dr., San Diego, CA 92106
